title: Every single hook champion in the game is overpowered.
body:
We all hear the constant complaints about Morgana being overpowered.  Here's an unpopular opinion: how about every single hook champion is overpowered and only Morgana has reasonable counter play. 

A hook from Thresh, Pyke, Nautilus, and Blitzcrank is essentially death and literally the only counter play to it is to either 1.) dodge it all the time or 2.) flash.  

Yet we've been told by the community repeatedly that expecting people to dodge is not reasonable counter play.  See Zoe.   How is it different with hook champions?  

Do you think its a coincidence that the some of the best ADC players in the world like Tyler1 strong prefer aggressive hook champion supports?  He knows how good they are.  

I played a normal game yesterday against a bunch of silvers.  I'm a mid/high plat Morgana one trick.  I've played thousands upon thousands of Morgana games.  I was randomly matched with a gold adc main.  

In lane the enemy Nautilus was able to completely zone us and kill my adc.  Nautilus hook has a 14 second CD.  Black shield has a 23 second, and soon to be 26 second, cooldown.   My Caitlyn was unable to dodge a single hook in lane and died 7 times.  

So you're telling me that Morgana completely hard counters CC champions and I'm a high plat/low diamond Morgana one trick pony and my adc goes 0/7 in lane to a silver Nautilus?  What an insane hard counter!  Imagine if I was Janna or playing against an evenly skilled support.  I guess my adc would have gone 0/14.  

The truth is that the hook class of support champions are simply too powerful right now.  Yes, Black Shield will stop plays from being made, but most CC abilities have around half of the cooldown of black shield.  So consistently engaging against Morgana and her adc will almost always work.  Dark binding isn't even enough because it doesn't stop damage from being dealt by the enemy adc.  

And keep in mind I'm talking about Morgana.  She is the BEST champion in the game against this class of support.   There is literally no counter play at all to hook champions besides dodging except for Morgana.  And you're nerfing Morgana.

What's worse is that players who play these types of champions honestly believe Morgana is the unfun champion to play against.  Because everyone sure loves fighting Pyke, Blitz, Thresh, and Nautilus where one misstep means death.  

If Morgana is going to be nerfed and banned consistently then other supports need to be buffed/nerfed.  

Janna and Lulu need some major buffs.  Hook champions need some damage and cc nerfs.

People queue to play League of Legends.  The keyword here is play.  Being CCed and unable to act for 10 years because Pyke has 14 stuns is not enjoyable for anyone except for the Pyke.  

It's time for a reality check: the real cancer in this game are the hook champions.  They have all the power of dive champions but none of the risk.  Blitz isn't going to suddenly die if he misses a hook.  Neither are Thresh or Pyke.   Compare that to any of the enchanters in the game who miss an ability.  They're dead.   

Hooks need severe nerfs.

For half a second. Or 0.35 seconds with Merc's. Or 0.25 seconds with Merc's and Legend: Tenacity.

Yet its not like every hook champion you'll face in your life will be god tier good at them. I'm a m7 Blitzcrank main that doesn't hook well in all honesty and I can say he definitely does not need a nerf. His q starts around 20 seconds without any cd at the beginning of the game, and on top of that a Blitzcrank can only pull 2 maybe 3 at the beginning due to his Q costing 100 mana per pull. Thresh Q is also around the same cd at the beginning of the game. Pyke and Naut (Naut who needed some buffs in all honesty) is another champion like blitz though his Q can be used on terrain and has a bigger hitbox. I can go on and on about the times I thought I could hook someone but the minion that happens to be a hair out gets pulled instead. Hook champions don't need nerfs like you're stating. Apologies about the ADC you got in your morg game but that doesn't constitute a nerf on all hook champions.

Blitz is probably the worst of the hook champions atm.  His kit is sorta out dated.  Are you pleased with the changes in 9.9?  

But the truth is if he does land a hook it is death generally or its going to burn flash.  He has tremendous kill pressure and just the fear of a hook is a lot of pressure. 

Morgana versus Blitz doesn't have the same pressure.  Morgana simply cannot possibly do enough damage to kill blitz unless the blitz is consistently out of position.  Morgana is completely reactive in this match up, and that gives Blitz lane priority which is a big deal.

You just said Blitz is the worst hook champion atm and are still claiming they need to nerf him. When he goes to pull hes standing still which gives opportunity to cc him. Besides that he has to get up close to really do much besides pull, meanwhile morg can q, e, auto at him without really worrying about being pulled. Have minions? Stand behind them. Blitz and other hook champions cannot do much vs a wall of them. Thresh is the only one who can really do much only because of his auto range.

probably the fact that 

1) hook champions have much, much shorter ranges of influence, due to minions

2) morgana has free instant aoe wave clear from w 

3) t1 prefers aggressive supports because he plays hyper aggressive adc's

4) your caitlyn should flat out have never been in range to be hooked, and has e to dodge it. she just got outplayed. 

5) what's cancer about morgana is how far she can move without actually putting her self in danger and getting decent harass, as most hook champions you just mentioned are melee ranged.

6) hook based champions missing a hook does mean they practically cant act until that hook is back up regardless.

She has the auto attack range of thresh and her W does no damage for its mana cost.  All the weaknesses you claim hook champions have also apply to Morgana's Q.  

You can definitely beat Morgana as any hook champion if you're good at the champion.  You just have to be able to land your skill shots.  Worst case scenario you go even in lane.  

If you ever die to Morgana in lane you've severely misplayed.  She has no kill pressure versus any of the champions I've listed.  Like actually zero kill pressure.

I agree and disagree with you at the same time. I do not feel morgana needs a nerf (like, come on. I already try to max my E second but that is a little rediculous for a cooldown) nor do I feel hook champions are over powered.

I pick Morgana if I see a enemy hooker, but yet I also pick Blitzcrank into Morgana (cause i like to troll and bait out the black shields :^) lol)

The only "support" champ that i feel needs a bit of a nerf is Fiddlesticks's point and click instant cast 3 second fear. Which its funny that people claim Morgana is op because of her bind, but he fears for the same time and it absolutely ruins Yi and any phase rush champs trying to engage. Plus it acts more like a stun, and he can silence from a distance as well.

Morgana support is situationally decent and perhaps underpowered, but she's received a lot of attention due to her update and so people bandwagon ban her.  

Her mid situation is a bit more complex. 

The funny thing is that Bliz has a favorable win rate versus Morgana last I checked.  Most of the hook champions can and do be her in even skill match ups. But since most players in this game are silver and have no ability to do things like bait black shield and Q they just bitch and moan.  

I think the only supports Morgana actually stomps are Alistar and Leona.  

But yeah a lot of good blitzcranks will just run at you hoping you pop black shield reactively or throw a Q.  The really good cranks I see generally go for an E knockup rather than an initial hook. 

Yeah, the fiddles thing is ridiculous, but he's not in the spotlight right now so he won't receiving any nerfs.  If he got a skin next week or something people would be crying about him.  It's so predictable.

I wouldnt say underpowered, but not overpowered, but yes. That is a very common trend unfortunately. "I dont want to learn how to play against X champ... daddy Rito nerf them!" And yet at the same time they are like "daddy rito is so mean! They never listen to me and they are trying to take away my toys like Guinsoos on Master Yi!"

It is honestly rediculous how bipolar peoples thoughts are. They cant ever see a middle ground. Its like they usually play a game with cheats on to make them invincible... then claim to be the best players in the game.... then complain when they jump off a cliff into oblivion and still die. XD

High risk high reward. Most of the hook champions are putting themselves in a spot of danger AND have long cooldowns early game. Not to mention they are very telegraphed by the wind up. So yeah they should be very effective if they land the skill shot if I pull MF between minions because I calculated it.

They are totally in danger when they pull someone into a 1v5 dragon pit, or into a 1v2 bot lane.

They are totally in danger when their kit gives them a huge shield when below 30% HP. Totally.

Still high risk high reward. I’m sticking to my guns. A soraka can sit back and just kite and heal for back line and not really be in danger compared to trying to bust out plays like thresh or pyke. I’m not saying one is more important than then other. I’m just saying they aren’t OP just because they have lock down and engage.

Lmfao...... Soraka sitting back and healing is killing herself. A GOOD Soraka is far more vulnerable than that and far more useful.

Pyke is only in danger if he's bad..... (The irony you're trying to argue the support with the least average deaths per game and the highest kills...... is "in danger")

Thresh only needs {{item:3117}} and then his win rate skyrockets.
Ok you’re right. There is 0 skill needed for hook champions.

Not saying that. I'm saying that trying to suggest they need skill at a base level performance is some fallacious argument. 

There's plenty of skill expression to be had:

- Using Relic shield to kill a minion block, and then Q through the gap they create.
- Hooking a target behind a target by using the edge of a hitbox.
- Trying to mitigate Morg's shield and using it properly to win the lane for your team, not hers.
- Lantern/forward aggression plays

etc etc.

What I'm saying is the base kit is extraordinarily powerful, and in many situations doesn't have a counter. 

-There's no minion block near a Drake or Baron circle. That's not "skill." That's "basic use."
-Mobis allow them to easily bypass minion blocks. That's not skill.
-On board tankiness and no item damage outstrips fully built offensive champions in most cases. (Blitz can duel Zyra and win so hard that he's actually listed as a counter due to his low HP barrier and double damage E)
-Compared to champs like {{champion:89}} , their risk is minimal, because they do not have to go in. they bring one in for an execution, while Leona may actually die for hers.
-The range surpasses most mage skills.
WHAT lol.   How is a hook high risk?  You really gotta explain this one to me.

Most the time when you are being aggressive to hook you step forward or put yourself in a spot where it isn’t as safe. If you throw a hook and hit great! If you miss you not only have to retreat to a safe spot but one of moves is on cooldown as well. Play thresh for 100 games into as many match ups as possible and you’ll see how it is risky to step forward to hook.

You stepping forward makes everyone else step back.  I suppose it depends on the match up.  Against other dive champions sure.  But you're not going to see Sorakas, Morganas, and other enchanters just rush into melee against you and beat you down.   The exception might be the level 2 power spike.

Yasuo support.
